Product Name: Back to LG 32" Ultra-Gear QHD (2560 x 1440) Gaming Monitor, 165Hz, 1ms, Black 32GN600-B.Aus, New
Title: Poorly thought out design
Review Text: Monitor works fine (in a quiet sort of way) but have had a few bad surprises along the way. Three issues so far - a typical VESA mount blocks the monitor connectors, LG website says "yes" speaker but none (I guess they mean a headphone jack), and the tranformer is mounted on a three prong plug and is massive so limits flexibility. The biggest disappointment so far was the connector locations for the VESA mount - they are too close to the center of the monitor back and stick straight out rather than down. Better find a very tight, small VESA mount if want it to work well (if they exist) or super spacers beyond my comfort level (already doubled up) with longer screws then what comes with the VESA mount (manual did not say how deep the screws ...

Review Text: Cannot get the Display Port to work with my Xbox Series X or PS5 using either a DP to HDMI adapter or direct DP to HDMI cable. I tried changing the DP port versions (1.1, 1.2 %261.4), but none of those worked.

Product Name: Back to LG 32" Ultra-Gear QHD (2560 x 1440) Gaming Monitor, 165Hz, 1ms, Black 32GN600-B.Aus, New
Title: Hidden Flaws (HDMI ports)
Review Text:
As someone who is ok with technology but not exceptional this monitor had all the things I was looking for. I did my homework just to learn about refresh rates, 4k, response times, etc. So I was excited for a monitor that could do 4k at 120hz let alone 165hz.

Unfortunately what I didn't learn until after I bought it was that my monitor has HDMI 2.0 ports that can't handle 120fps at 4k. I even went out and bought a new series x Xbox to play on this and unfortunately I had to learn the hard way. 

I also had some pixels out but the monitor was shipped thru a third party.

Product Name: Back to LG 32" Ultra-Gear QHD (2560 x 1440) Gaming Monitor, 165Hz, 1ms, Black 32GN600-B.Aus, New
Title: No Title
Review Text: Good monitor for the price $250. HDR not achievable over HDMI if you want a high refresh rate and pixel density. Display Port is required to support higher bandwidths which is not a readily available option on console and some computers. 1ms response time is only achievable if freesync is turned off. Product Name: Back to LG 32" Ultra-Gear QHD (2560 x 1440) Gaming Monitor, 165Hz, 1ms, Black 32GN600-B.Aus, New
Title: Too big if you have a small desk, great otherwise.
Review Text: Awesome monitor, I use it with my Xbox series X and 120fps is amazing on this. Resolution is good, not 4k but you need an OLED or QLED monitor to get 165hz and 4k so I cant really complain. I will say this though, the thing is HUGE. If you have a small desk and are using Mouse and Keyboard it will be like you are front row at a theater. I would suggest a smaller monitor if you have a small desk or will be close to this thing. Thats my only gripe about it right now. Assembly took 5 minutes, setup took 2. Literally build plug and play. Hope this helps!

Product Name: Back to LG 32" Ultra-Gear QHD (2560 x 1440) Gaming Monitor, 165Hz, 1ms, Black 32GN600-B.Aus, New
Title: Good quality, just one complaint.

Product Name: Back to LG 32" Ultra-Gear QHD (2560 x 1440) Gaming Monitor, 165Hz, 1ms, Black 32GN600-B.Aus, New
Title: DO NOT INSTALL THE OSD SOFTWARE ON A MAC
Review Text:
The OSD software, and a new Mac Mini connected with DP cable is junk. It caused my screen to flash black off and on continuously. It's not needed anyway for most people.
The bad: The joystick OSD control doesn't respond really well. Never had this experience and I own 5 32 inch LG monitors. Quite a bit of the time I have to hit the same click twice on the joystick for it to take. The OSD stays on the screen far too long by itself. You can dismiss it (but only sometimes) by continuously clicking to the left.
Otherwise, the picture is fantastic, what I expect from LG. No complaints, very short response times and great color. Just don't install the software and you're fine.

Product Name: Back to LG 32" Ultra-Gear QHD (2560 x 1440) Gaming Monitor, 165Hz, 1ms, Black 32GN600-B.Aus, New
Title: No Title
Review Text: This is a nice monitor. It isn't pixelated for me but there are a few issues.  It isn't really a 1ms response time, it is 5ms with an option of 1ms blur reduction WHICH YOU CANNOT USE WITH FREESYNC. You have to pick one or the other. There are no built in speakers either. I'm used to every monitor I've had having them so I didn't even think about it. The build quality is nice but the plastic covers they have on everything look cheap.

Product Name: Back to LG 32" Ultra-Gear QHD (2560 x 1440) Gaming Monitor, 165Hz, 1ms, Black 32GN600-B.Aus, New
Title: Great monitor but not suitable for hdr
Review Text: I grabbed this at an amazing price for Black Friday. Picture looks great and the refresh rate was a nice bump from my 60 hertz. The only complaint is that the screen isn't not bright enough to actually do hdr properly but in my use I don't need that from a monitor.

Product Name: Back to LG 32" Ultra-Gear QHD (2560 x 1440) Gaming Monitor, 165Hz, 1ms, Black 32GN600-B.Aus, New
Title: Great monitor, but can not use all of the features
Review Text:
My old HP 24-inch, 30-pound, flat-screen monitor lasted 10 years, but was on death's door just as this monitor went on sale!
This monitor weighs in at around 3 pounds and works great for me. Why then did I give it only four stars? 
My 12-year-old computer will not allow me to take advantage of the features (165 Hz, and 2560 x 1440 resolution). The lesson I want to share with the audience: Make sure your computer can use these features or you will just be wasting your money.
I usually only use the internet (research), MS Word, Excel, and a few other programs (no gaming), so I probably will not even miss the features.

Product Name: Back to LG 32" Ultra-Gear QHD (2560 x 1440) Gaming Monitor, 165Hz, 1ms, Black 32GN600-B.Aus, New
Title: Great Monitor
Review Text:
This is an excellent gaming monitor, and a good office monitor for the money.  For office work, mainly full screen spreadsheets, you will lose a little image on the far left and right edges.  It's the way the monitor works, and has to do with the angle of view center out.  It's fine dead on.  Could be annoying to some people, but I find it tolerable.  Everything else about the monitor is completely awesome, so worth any design limitations.  Cost to benefit ratio works for me.  32" is a noticeable increase in real estate.  

I paid $169 on sale at Walmart for the monitor.  

Should be a superb gaming monitor.

Product Name: Back to LG 32" Ultra-Gear QHD (2560 x 1440) Gaming Monitor, 165Hz, 1ms, Black 32GN600-B.Aus, New

Product Name: Back to LG 32" Ultra-Gear QHD (2560 x 1440) Gaming Monitor, 165Hz, 1ms, Black 32GN600-B.Aus, New
Title: Works with Nvidia 9-Series and above!
Review Text:
If you have an old 9-Series Nvidia card, this will WORK as VRR with DisplayPort.  If you have a 10-Series and higher it will work in G-Sync with DisplayPort.  I have tested this monitor on a 980 TI, Titan Xp, and a 4090.

The small downside is that it is a VA Panel, so the viewing angle is pretty bad.  The color gamut is okay.

All things considered with how much you pay it would be a really great buy to an okay buy.

Title: Best Feature is Price but Still Plenty More to it.
Review Text: I picked this up on discount for 250USD and definitely got my money's worth. Coming from a 2560x1080 "ultrawide" to 2560x1440 was a nice transition and didn't disrupt my workflow. And then I was scared to go any lower than 32" in physical size because of this transition so this monitor fit the bill. Ultimately the 32" might be a bit much. I like it! That much is for sure. But when typing I am too close to it. You lose some of the viewing angle at the far left and right of the screen as you come in closer. A monitor arm that is on the way and a desk rearrangement should solve this though (which I will mention the stand is the bare minimum with no adjustments and a downward tilt so a monitor arm is strongly recommended). Product Name: Back to LG 32" Ultra-Gear QHD (2560 x 1440) Gaming Monitor, 165Hz, 1ms, Black 32GN600-B.Aus, New
Title: Nice monitor, but not for me
Review Text: I had an HP 27" IPS monitor.  I thought I would like the extra display area of this LG, and I did.  However, being a VA panel, this monitor has a smaller viewing angle.  I typically sit 24" from a monitor and that leaves the left and right edges of the screen a little bit milky.  If I wanted to see the edge perfectly, I had to move my head a little bit left or right to see it.  Comparing it to the old monitor, I do like the detail of the 1440 over the 1080.  I can see the pixels on the 1080 screen, I don't notice them on the 1440.  Once again, the problem is that I need to sit 3 to 3.5 feet away to make the screen edges clear.  If I was just using this for gaming, I think it would work.  For a PC monitor, it doesn't work for me.  I did appr...

Product Name: Back to LG 32" Ultra-Gear QHD (2560 x 1440) Gaming Monitor, 165Hz, 1ms, Black 32GN600-B.Aus, New
Title: Overall a very competent monitor
Review Text: Overall, the monitor is quite well for the price range.  With Intel HD4000 integrated graphics, I was just able to obtain 60 Hz refresh rate.  Fortunately, I do not do gaming, so not able to fully utilize the high refresh rate is not a problem with me.  The overall text and graphics are sharp enough, although some reviews complained about the the low pixel per inch compared with the more expensive monitors.  The only thing I would complain are the subtle black smudges under a bright white screen. Other than that, I am completely happy with it.

Title: Good News: Its G-Sync Compatible according to Nvid
Review Text:
-Like the title says; according to Nvida control panel, it is G-Sync Compatible.  So I tested it out and to my surprise no tearing/ghosting/flickering.

-I read a ton of comments and some saying that the monitor had notable pixilation, but to my experience, I saw no pixilation what so ever. Its only only until my eye balls were touching the screen that I could see it.

-Color is great, the UI for fixing color, profiles, etc is super easy to control and to navigate.

-Thin boarders make it super sleek. 

-In love with it right now and will pick up another one if the price is right again.

Product Name: Back to LG 32" Ultra-Gear QHD (2560 x 1440) Gaming Monitor, 165Hz, 1ms, Black 32GN600-B.Aus, New
Title: Great monitor for the price. Better than expected!
Review Text:
It's a good monitor, especially for the price. 

I have a 27" with 2560 x 1440 and it's crisp, but images and type are too small. This 32" with 2560 x 1440 isn't as crisp because the pixels are spread over a larger area. 

That said, it's better than the 27" 1920 x 1040 I had before, and with a little bit of tweaking to the brightness, contrast, gamma and vibrancy, it's pretty darn nice! 

I expected a slight reduction in sharpness, but this is quite a bit better than I imagined it would be.

Title: Great while it lasted
Review Text:
I was quite surprised with how good the picture quality on this was when I first opened it. The design of the unit from the frame to the stand is sleek and looked great on my desk. 

Unfortunately, after less than a year, the monitor just stopped working. The power button shows it to be on and connected to a source but no picture will display. There is the faintest hint of a back light turning off when I switch off the display, but other than that it is completely dead. 

I wanted to recommend this for the value and quality, but it‚Äôs pretty clear that spending the extra money for a better brand is likely well worth it.

Product Name: Back to onn. 22" FHD (1920 x 1080p) 60hz Office Monitor with 4.8 ft HDMI Cable, Black
Title: Great monitor for the price.
Review Text: Has a bright, clear, sharp display... The base stand comes in two pieces that is held together with two screws, that you must put in yourself. The screws provided were way too large for the holes that you are to screw them into, so I had to drill out the holes to fit the screws. The screws provided were those used to assemble particle board, thus not made for plastic. You can still put the base together without the screws, but I preferred them in for stability. When viewing a circle on the screen, the circle is not perfectly round, but not enough to really bother you. For the low price, I would say that this is great monitor for the money, and I am really satisfied with it...

Title: Fast but broke fast too
Review Text:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased a 15z-ef100 on Black Friday, received the laptop a couple days before Christmas of 2020, and last night (Jan 19, 2020), it stopped being able to power on. There is an orange flashing light near the power cord when it is plugged in, and it stayed like that even after being plugged in overnight. I have to send it in for repairs.  
Not only that, but my kids' mom bought an identical laptop for our other child on the same day, and its wifi module failed, so it is also going in for repairs.  

Other than not being able to use the laptops right now, they were great leading up to not working. They were fast and performed just as our kids hoped they would.

Product Name: Back to HP 15 15.6" FHD Premium Laptop Computer, Intel Core i5-1135G7 (Beat i7-1065G7), 32GB DDR4 RAM, 1TB PCIe SSD, 802.11AC WiFi, Bluetooth 5.0, Natural Silver, Windows 11 Home in S Mode
Title: You get what you pay for.
Review Text: You get what you pay for. It's cheap feeling, the keyboard flexes a lot while typing and the way the layout is set with the additional num pad makes typing feel weird. It's nice that you can upgrade the RAM as it's not soldered to the board but there is only space for one SSD so if you want to upgrade you'll have to reinstall Windows while you're at it. The USB C slot does not offer power delivery so you'll always need to lug the power brick with power lug around with you. Overall, it's a serviceable laptop for cheap but don't expect it to feel or compare to something even twice the price. Doesn't seem/feel like it will hold up over a long period of time.

Product Name: Back to HP 15 15.6" FHD Premium Laptop Computer, Intel Core i5-1135G7 (Beat i7-1065G7), 32GB DDR4 RAM, 1TB PCIe SSD, 802.11AC WiFi, Bluetooth 5.0, Natural Silver, Windows 11 Home in S Mode
Title: Don't buy
Review Text: Windows 11 requires 4GB of RAM, which this has, but that makes this laptop VERY SLOW. Since it's max Ram is the minimum for the operating system, poor thought behind this build. Should have a previous windows operating system

Product Name: Back to HP 15 15.6" FHD Premium Laptop Computer, Intel Core i5-1135G7 (Beat i7-1065G7), 32GB DDR4 RAM, 1TB PCIe SSD, 802.11AC WiFi, Bluetooth 5.0, Natural Silver, Windows 11 Home in S Mode
Title: Poor quality Peripherals
Review Text: Laptop runs smooth and looks great on the exterior. Some moderate flex in the keyboard and the backlight is dim and turns off often. Tracpad is horrible, much lower quality than I would expect on a laptop of this price. Screen is bright and clear, touchscreen is accurate. Runs smoothly and meets my needs otherwise.

Product Name: Back to HP 15 15.6" FHD Premium Laptop Computer, Intel Core i5-1135G7 (Beat i7-1065G7), 32GB DDR4 RAM, 1TB PCIe SSD, 802.11AC WiFi, Bluetooth 5.0, Natural Silver, Windows 11 Home in S Mode
Title: Disappointed.
Review Text: Disappointed. That's the word that I would use after receiving and having used my HP laptop for two (2) solid weeks now. I previously had an 17" HP Envy that is 8 years-old, and still relatively "bulletproof", but was starting a new business and wanted to put a clean laptop into play. Product Name: Back to HP 15 15.6" FHD Premium Laptop Computer, Intel Core i5-1135G7 (Beat i7-1065G7), 32GB DDR4 RAM, 1TB PCIe SSD, 802.11AC WiFi, Bluetooth 5.0, Natural Silver, Windows 11 Home in S Mode
Title: Lack of OS customization costs it a star
Review Text:
Maybe silver was a mistake; at some angles, it can be difficult to see the symbols on the keys for when I have to do something I'm not accustomed to. The computer is very light, and the battery lasts for several hours, which is great. Surprisingly, the fan is on the bottom. These are, ultimately, only slight hiccups.

Windows 11 is by far the worst part. Even accounting for the learning curve with new operating systems, 11's minimalism and lack of customization makes hobbles production, particularly when it comes to organizing files. The taskbar groups all windows in program tabs and cannot be made smaller. The files even in list form have empty space. That might be aesthetically pleasing for some but makes it difficult to organize files....

Product Name: Back to HP 15 15.6" FHD Premium Laptop Computer, Intel Core i5-1135G7 (Beat i7-1065G7), 32GB DDR4 RAM, 1TB PCIe SSD, 802.11AC WiFi, Bluetooth 5.0, Natural Silver, Windows 11 Home in S Mode
Title: Good deal for the price
Review Text: It's a relatively fast laptop for the price. However, I do wish that the Type-C port allowed you to charge your phone, and that the USB ports were 3.0. Furthermore, it's virtually impossible to have two thumb drives plugged in at once because the two USB 2.0 ports are so close to each other. Why such a poor design? I had to buy a USB hub to be able to use multiple thumb drives.

Product Name: Back to HP 15 15.6" FHD Premium Laptop Computer, Intel Core i5-1135G7 (Beat i7-1065G7), 32GB DDR4 RAM, 1TB PCIe SSD, 802.11AC WiFi, Bluetooth 5.0, Natural Silver, Windows 11 Home in S Mode
Title: Very good hardware.
Review Text: Generally, I like the laptop. I did not read the specs closely enough to understand that one of the USB ports is a type C. I miss the third USB type A port of my old machine. I use the machine for scientific calculations, no games. I'm positively impressed with the performance. How much of the performance improvement is due to the cores or the SSD rather than a hard drive is unclear but the result is significant. While not the subject of this review having to use Windows 11 rather than Windows 10 has been a less than happy experience.

Product Name: Back to HP 15 15.6" FHD Premium Laptop Computer, Intel Core i5-1135G7 (Beat i7-1065G7), 32GB DDR4 RAM, 1TB PCIe SSD, 802.11AC WiFi, Bluetooth 5.0, Natural Silver, Windows 11 Home in S Mode
Title: Good entry level laptop
Review Text:
The rules on reviews prevent me from giving an full assessment of this product. Only product features can be referenced. I can say that this laptop works very well for common tasks such as web browsing, streaming video, etc. I've had this laptop for about a week now.

Pros: 
1) Seems only a bit slower than my 2-3 year old i7 laptop (8GB RAM). Pretty fast.
2) Has 8GB RAM, necessary for many of today's needs.
3) This unit runs regular Windows 10, allowing use of all apps. Windows 10 S (found on many entry level units) prevents using apps that don't come from a proprietary apps store (eg. no YouTube TV, etc). 
4) It's quiet.
5) Narrow screen bezels mean the unit fits into what used to be a case for 14" laptops.
6) Good speakers, plenty...

Review Text:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This purchase was for a gift.  The recipient needed a basic laptop, not a lot of HHD storage capacity and a decent webcam/mic/speaker set for Zoom and other videoconferencing Apps. This product met all of those requirements.  It has a small SSHDD of 128 GB nominal capacity, with about 80 GB net after loading in the OS and productivity software, etc.  It is not for a serious gamer or for someone who surfs the Web all day, downloads everything in sight and never deletes anything off their HDD or transfers any large files from the HDD to flash drives. 

As with all Win 10 PC's the user has to decide whether to log in with a "local" account or a Microsoft account.  This is initially decided ...

Also, you have to pay extra for a backlit keyboard, thought that was an automatic feature but found out when I got it that it was something additional.

Title: Great laptop for the cost.
Review Text: I had done a lot of research on laptops. Comparing price and quality. Including but not limited to, speeds, storage and function. This one came in at the top of my list. Due to it having everything I needed including a decent price tag. I work from home, so having a quality laptop is important to me. This charges quickly? But also holds a charge all day while I'm working. It's relatively fast for me and what I need it for. I usually have anywhere from 5-7 tabs open at once and am bouncing back and forth between them all day. And this laptop keeps up. My internet is crap, but we're switching to fiber soon so I'm hoping I'll see this work even better with better internet speeds. The laptop is very sleek and nice looking. I had mine customized...

Product Name: Back to HP 15 15.6" FHD Premium Laptop Computer, Intel Core i5-1135G7 (Beat i7-1065G7), 32GB DDR4 RAM, 1TB PCIe SSD, 802.11AC WiFi, Bluetooth 5.0, Natural Silver, Windows 11 Home in S Mode
Title: Would buy again
Review Text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought 3 of these for my kids for Christmas and they love them. I had bought some high end chrome books and those didn't cut it, but these do. Great for all around use and some gaming.  Plays Roblox and all other games I've thrown at them.  The screen is perfect size and I bought the higher res screen and lit keyboard which are great adders for the $$. Super light and mobile.  3 colors for my 3 kids and all colors look great. Overall this was a sweet laptop and now I wish I had one. I'm jealous of my kids!

The shipping was delayed overseas, and I was afraid that I wouldn't receive it by his birthday, but HP support got on it and I received it just in time. Thank you for keeping track of the shipping and seeing the problem.

Product Name: Back to HP Stream 14" Laptop, Intel Celeron N4120 Processor, 4GB RAM, 64GB eMMC, Pink, Windows 11 (S mode) with Office 365 1-yr, 14-cf2112wm
Title: Good   "Bad", please read full review.
Review Text: This product is pretty nice. My co-worker bought it for another co-worker, and I was there when setting it up which caught my interest. I would recommend this laptop to others! The only little "issue" that I have seen is it can run a little slow, on some apps/websites it runs fine but then others it will take a few extra seconds to load and when they do load it lags a bit and kicks you out of said app/website. On the good hand, I love the keyboard except when the light hits it can be hard to see what keys you are hitting if you don't have it memorized.  The speakers aren't to bad themselves, pretty loud when all the way up. The screen is a great size not hard to see. The pixels of the print on screen are amazing I can read everything unlike...

Product Name: Back to HP Stream 14" Laptop, Intel Celeron N4120 Processor, 4GB RAM, 64GB eMMC, Pink, Windows 11 (S mode) with Office 365 1-yr, 14-cf2112wm
Title: HP Laptop
Review Text: The laptop is nice. I have a little trouble with it freezing up. It does what I need, its just this freezing up that causes me a lot of aggravation. I am getting it worked out. It's just all these apps running in the background that causes the problems.

Product Name: Back to HP Stream 14" Laptop, Intel Celeron N4120 Processor, 4GB RAM, 64GB eMMC, Pink, Windows 11 (S mode) with Office 365 1-yr, 14-cf2112wm
Title: Update issues
Review Text: When I started up the computer, it seemed a bit slow  I used the computer for two days before an update was required. Not thinking anything of it, I selected the recommended install and update option.  After waiting for two days of the computer just buffering, I had to call for tech support which they ended up walking me through factory resetting my computer. Luckily I hadn't done any serious work just yet. They said the issue was because of Windows not updating correctly. Hopefully, moving forward everything goes smoothly.

Product Name: Back to HP Stream 14" Laptop, Intel Celeron N4120 Processor, 4GB RAM, 64GB eMMC, Pink, Windows 11 (S mode) with Office 365 1-yr, 14-cf2112wm
Title: Resonable price.
Review Text: Good buy if you want a laptop that is simple and to do your basic web searching and Microsoft applications. I just refuse to keep buying apple or higher-end computers and they end up being outdated with a few months to a year...I don't need all that memory and ram to do the simple things....

Product Name: Back to HP Stream 14" Laptop, Intel Celeron N4120 Processor, 4GB RAM, 64GB eMMC, Pink, Windows 11 (S mode) with Office 365 1-yr, 14-cf2112wm
Title: Beautiful, Fast, and Easy (with a little scare)
Review Text: This laptop color is absolutely stunning even the keys are the same color, it's speedy, one problem I had at the beginning it was saying there was unusual activity or a virus on the computer just 5 mins of use, I was ready to take it back but then I honestly believe it was a update because the computer shut down and started working even better, there Is not a issue, there is not a dent, bump, or scratch, she came with charger and ready to go, the setting up process was quick and easy, everything connected no problem, I'm going to be using the laptop to start my digital marketing career so I will come back and update after a month of use! But so far absolutely worth the buy!!

its great...but...it has free Office.yy360, but only free for a very short indtoductory time

Product Name: Back to HP Stream 14" Laptop, Intel Celeron N4120 Processor, 4GB RAM, 64GB eMMC, Pink, Windows 11 (S mode) with Office 365 1-yr, 14-cf2112wm
Title: its a celeron manage expectations and its good.
Review Text: this is a nice basic unit. (not a gaming laptop dont kid yourself do notvbuy this for gaming. the specs dont support it, and now you have been warned so you have noone but yourself to blame.). nice minimalist notebook though. for checking emails and online shopping solid internet connection definitely a decent deal for the money. use mine for monitoring crypto prices watching netflix etc. i can see it working well for college basics taking motes. combine it with a thumb drive and you have a decent work machine with a reasonable though not eatth shattering screen. onboard speakers are a little weak but not unliveable.

Product Name: Back to HP Stream 14" Laptop, Intel Celeron N4120 Processor, 4GB RAM, 64GB eMMC, Pink, Windows 11 (S mode) with Office 365 1-yr, 14-cf2112wm

Product Name: Back to HP Stream 14" Laptop, Intel Celeron N4120 Processor, 4GB RAM, 64GB eMMC, Pink, Windows 11 (S mode) with Office 365 1-yr, 14-cf2112wm
Title: Nice laptop.
Review Text: Bought it for my Mom to replace an HP all in one desktop that crashed and was sent as a gift last year for my Mom from my brother. She had sent the computer back to my brother in Arkansas to be repaired by him or the place of purchase. She missed her computer. She's 85 years old and enjoys sitting at her desk and exploring the web and communicating through emails, etc., so this looked like a good substitute til she gets her desktop back. I set it all up for her and she likes it, shes excited to be back on the internet. Very satisfied with this reconditioned like new HP laptop.

Product Name: Back to HP Stream 14" Laptop, Intel Celeron N4120 Processor, 4GB RAM, 64GB eMMC, Pink, Windows 11 (S mode) with Office 365 1-yr, 14-cf2112wm
Title: IMPORTANT: Reboot After Purchase!!!
Review Text: I got my laptop very quickly. Its nice and lightweight. Great for business! I was a little reluctant considering the reviews but for the price and color it was worth the shot. Of course it took about 20 minutes to completely boot up the first time and it ran a little slow. So I called my brother was works in IT and he informed me to ALWAYS restart the computer after turning on for the first time and Wa La! It runs like normal. Hopefully this helps everyone's issue. Also always restart after large downloads. If this lasts me at least two years it's definitely worth every penny.
